overview: Bret Kugelmass has entrepreneurial attitude with a penchant for all things robotics, stemming as early as high school . Experience leading teams at NASA, research at Berkeley’s Center for Integrated Nanomechanical Systems, and equipment design at Silicon Valley solar startup Nanosolar predated his master’s in mechanical engineering at Stanford. ​ During his time at Stanford, Bret was involved in projects including consumer electronics design (a credit card with embedded electronics) and manufacturing design for a biodegradable toothbrush. Bret was invited to stay on under a Center for Design Research fellowship for his second year and during that time designed an electric city-share concept car from scratch with his newly founded research group, thanks to Panasonic’s generous support. ​ Since graduation he has received a certificate from Stanford Graduate’s School of Business, founded a discontinued web startup, Eventative, and now is co-founder and CEO of start-up Airphrame, an unmanned aerial imaging platform.
